answer.text: I grow most of my own vegetables, or buy packaging-free fruits & vegetables at farmers markets.
I try to avoid single-serving sizes and buy bulk-size and minimally packaged products whenever possible.
I try to choose items with less plastic packaging but it's not always easy.
I buy what's available at the supermarket, without worrying too much about how it's packaged.
I cook nearly all meals at home.
I very rarely eat take-out or delivery (1-2 times per month or less).
I eat delivery or take-out meals no more than a couple times per week.
I order delivery (such as Uber Eats) or take-out meals 3 or more times per week.
I very rarely consume bottled drinks from the store or vending machines.
I buy no more than 1-2 drinks in PET bottles per month.
I drink no more than 1-2 PET bottle drinks per week from vending machines, convenience stores, etc.
I drink 3+ PET bottle drinks per week from vending machines, convenience stores, etc.
I avoid plastic packaging on the items I buy from the supermarket.
I carry reusable bags, water bottle/cup, cutlery, straw, etc. to avoid disposables.
I occasionally receive plastic bags and/or disposable utensils at stores/restaurants, when I've forgotten to bring my own.
I often receive a plastic bag and/or disposable utensils at the cash register.
